title: Selection of a “housekeeping” miRNA to normalize qRT-PCR data
title_html: Selection of a “housekeeping” miRNA to normalize qRT-PCR data

source.description: Identifcation of a "housekeeping" microRNA among the 84 circulating of the Human Serum & Plasma miScript miRNA PCR Array (MIHS-106ZA, QIAGEN):
• a Ct range <20 Ct
• a 0.5FC1.5 (GeneGlobe Data Analysis Center)
• evaluation of expression level by qRT-PCR in all the enrolled samples by using the comparative Ct method quantification (2-ΔCt method).
Based on the above criteria, miR-15b-5p did not show any significant differences in expression level among CAD, AMI_T0 and AMI_T1 patients and could be our internal control.

description: The qRT-PCR expression analyses were performed on all the recruited patients (61 CAD, 38 AMI_T0 and 11 AMI_T1 patients respectively). Since the absence of a universally recognized miRNA with housekeeping properties, we have analyzed the amplification curve of 84 circulating microRNAs using the Human Serum & Plasma miScript miRNA PCR Array (MIHS-106ZA, QIAGEN).
